item.title: ICDAR 2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Scanned Receipts OCR and Information Extraction
item.description: Scanned receipts OCR and information extraction (SROIE) play critical roles in streamlining document-intensive processes and office automation in many financial, accounting and taxation areas.

item.title: ICDAR2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Large-scale Street View Text with Partial Labeling
item.description: This challenge focuses on scene text reading in natural images, which can be broken down into scene text detection and spotting problems, based on the proposed Large-scale Street View Text with Partial Labeling (LSVT) dataset.

item.title: ICDAR2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Arbitrary-Shaped Text
item.description: This is a challenge of scene text understanding, which can be broken down into scene text detection, recognition, and spotting problems. The main novelty of this competition resides in the nature of the competition's dataset - the ArT dataset.

item.title: ICDAR 2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Reading Chinese Text on Signboard
item.description: We collect and construct a practical and challenging multi-orientation natural scene text dataset (TORS-25K) with 25,000 images, which consist of lots of restaurant signboards. TORS dataset includes 25,000 labeled images that are collected in the wild by phone cameras under uncontrolled conditions. It mainly focuses on Chinese text on the restaurant signboards.

item.title: ICDAR 2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Scene Text Visual Question Answering
item.description: The ICDAR 2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Scene Text Visual Question Answering, focuses on a specific type of Visual Question Answering task, where understanding the textual information in a scene is necessary in order to give an answer.

item.title: ICDAR 2019 Robust Reading Challenge on Multi-lingual scene text detection and recognition
item.description: This new competition aims at assessing the ability of state of the art methods to detect and recognize multi-lingual text. This situation is encountered in modern cities where multiple cultures live and communicate together, where users see various scripts and languages in a way which prevent using much a priori knowledge. Multi-lingual text also poses a problem when analyzing streams of contents gathered on the Internet.

item.title: UG2+ PRIZE CHALLENGE
item.description: BRIDGING THE GAP BETWEEN COMPUTATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY AND VISUAL RECOGNITION: The UG2+ Challenge seeks to advance the analysis of "difficult" imagery by applying image restoration and enhancement algorithms to improve analysis performance. Participants are tasked with developing novel algorithms to improve the analysis of imagery captured under problematic conditions. Track 1: Video object classification and detection from unconstrained mobility platforms Track 2: Object Detection in Poor Visibility Environments
